sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"任命，委派"之意。
means: appoint ：通常指不经过选择的官方委任。
designate ：书面用语，侧重当权者或机构的选拔或任命，有时含强行指定的意味。
assign ：常指给一群人或个人分配、分派、指派或委派任务。
name ：普通用词，着重任命的结果，而不是过程。
nominate ：通常指为某一公职选择候选人，并将其提交给有决定权的人作最后决定。

sentence.Network_en: I nominate Tom to make the tea.
The public will be able to nominate candidates for awards such as the MBE.
sentence.Network_cn: 公众将可以推荐诸如英帝国勋章之类的奖项的候选人。

sentence.Network_en: Voters will choose fifty of the seventy five deputies. The Emir will nominate the rest.
sentence.Network_cn: 选民将选出75名代表中的50名，其余代表由埃米尔任命。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... nominal a 名义上的 nominate v 提名；任命 nominee n 被提名者.

中国特色词的译法 - Billwang 工业设计论坛 ... conduct 经营，处理 nominated 被提名的，被任命的 be promoted to 被提升为.

list.abs: 中国特色词的译法 - Billwang 工业设计论坛 ... conduct 经营，处理 nominated 被提名的，被任命的 be promoted to 被提升为.
名词化(nominalization)是“人类语言最普遍的特征之一,但是,我们对此的理解仍然是微乎其微”[1]。 英语书面语的一大特征就是名词化的 …
由于名义(nominal)利率已降无可降(实际上也不可能处于负数)，联储局得通过非传统手段(主要是购买国债和按揭抵押证券)，以达到等 …
常用机械英语词汇积累 - 彭斌 - 博客园 ... stroke： 行程 nominal： 标称的,额定 nominal stroke： 额定行程.
4，唯名论（nominalism）和多义性（polysemy）研究的观点。这方面的研究主要是对反映意识形态的流通符号，进行内在涵义的分析。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective in the sense 'named'): from Latin nominat- 'named', from the verb nominare, from nomen, nomin- 'a name'. The verb senses are first found in English in the 16th cent

entry.def: If someone is nominated for a job or position, their name is formally suggested as a candidate for it.

example.ex: Under party rules each candidate has to be nominated by 55 Labour MPs...
example.tran: 根据党章，每个候选人必须得到55名工党下院议员的提名。

example.ex: The public will be able to nominate candidates for awards such as the MBE.
example.tran: 公众将可以推荐诸如英帝国勋章之类的奖项的候选人。

entry.def: If you nominate someone to a job or position, you formally choose them to hold that job or position.

example.ex: Voters will choose fifty of the seventy five deputies. The Emir will nominate the rest...
example.tran: 选民将选出75名代表中的50名，其余代表由埃米尔任命。

example.ex: The EU would nominate two members to the committee...
example.tran: 欧盟将为该委员会指定两名成员。

entry.def: If someone or something such as an actor or a film is nominated for an award, someone formally suggests that they should be given that award.

example.ex: Practically every movie he made was nominated for an Oscar.
example.tran: 他执导的影片几乎每部都获得过奥斯卡奖提名。

example.ex: ...a campaign to nominate the twice World Champion as Sports Personality of the Year.
example.tran: 提名那位两届世界冠军获得者为年度体育人物的拉票活动

means.word_mean: 1. propose as a candidate for some honor
2. put forward; nominate for appointment to an office;

sentences.sentence: "The President nominated her as head of the Civil Rights Commission"

means.word_mean: 3. charge with a function; charge to be;

sentences.sentence: "She was named Head of the Committee"
"She was made president of the club"

means.word_mean: 4. create and charge with a task or function;

stems_affixes.word_buile: cog同+nomin名称,名字+al……的→adj.同名的,同姓的
ig不+nomin名称,名字+ious……的→不好的名字→可耻的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
stems_affixes.word_buile: nomin名称,名字+al表形容词→adj.名义上的;[金额,租金]微不足道的
denominate[v.命名,取名]+ion表名词→n.命名,[长度,币值的]单位
ig不+nomin名称,名字+y状态→不好的名字→可耻
nomin名称,名字+ee被动的人→被提名的人
de给予+nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→给予名称
nomin名称,名字+ate表动词→v.提名,任命

Sentence.sentence: In a division of electronic engineers, who were designing equipments so advanced that they work in teams of up to 150, co-workers and managers were asked to nominate the standouts- the stars in productivity and effectiveness
What characterizes the stars nominated at Bell Labs?
He is eager to be nominated the new editor.
